content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

## Count & Layers
The structure consists of 15 building blocks organized in multiple layers:
- Base layer: 4 orange cylindrical pillars (legs of the structure)
- Middle layer: 1 yellow rectangular block on top of the pillars
- Top layer: 1 orange cylinder on top of the yellow block with a yellow half-cylinder dome on top
- Side extension: A complex arrangement consisting of orange, blue, and green blocks

## Spatial Relationships
The structure resembles a table-like object with an extension:
1. Four orange cylindrical pillars form the base/legs in a rectangular arrangement
2. A horizontal yellow rectangular block sits on top of these pillars
3. A vertical orange cylinder stands in the center of the yellow block
4. A yellow half-cylinder dome caps the orange cylinder
5. Extending from one side is a complex assembly of blocks:
   - Orange blocks form the outer parts
   - Blue blocks form an inner framework
   - A green square block sits in the middle of this extension

# Required Blocks from Dictionary

Based on my analysis, I need the following blocks:
- 4× orange cylinders (block #8) for the legs
- 1× yellow rectangular block (block #6) for the table top
- 1× orange cylinder (block #8) for the vertical post
- 1× yellow half-cylinder dome (block #10 or #11) for the top cap
- 2× orange cubes (block #2) for parts of the extension
- 2× orange triangular prisms (block #16) for parts of the extension
- 1× orange rectangular prism (block #13) for part of the extension
- 1× orange thin block (block #12) for part of the extension
- 2× blue small cubes (block #5) for parts of the extension
- 1× larger blue cube (block #4) for part of the extension
- 1× green cube (block #1) for center of the extension

# Assembly Order

```
{
   Step1: Move block with index 8
   Step2: Move block with index 8
   Step3: Move block with index 8
   Step4: Move block with index 8
   Step5: Move block with index 6
   Step6: Move block with index 8
   Step7: Move block with index 10
   Step8: Move block with index 13
   Step9: Move block with index 16
   Step10: Move block with index 2
   Step11: Move block with index 2
   Step12: Move block with index 12
   Step13: Move block with index 16
   Step14: Move block with index 5
   Step15: Move block with index 1
   Step16: Move block with index 5
   Step17: Move block with index 4
}
```

This assembly order starts from the base (legs), builds up to the table structure, and finally constructs the side extension.
